class fntlib.main.Char(args: Optional[dict])[source]¶

Bases: fntlib.utils.DefaultClass

This class describes a character in the font.

Parameters:
  • id (int) – The character id.
  • x (int) – The left position of the character image in the texture.
  • y (int) – The top position of the character image in the texture.
  • width (int) – The width of the character image in the texture.
  • height (int) – The height of the character image in the texture.
  • xoffset (int) – How much the current position should be offset when copying the image from the texture to the screen.
  • yoffset (int) – How much the current position should be offset when copying the image from the texture to the screen.
  • xadvance (int) – How much the current position should be advanced after drawing the character.
  • page (int) – The texture page where the character image is found.
  • chnl (Channel) – The texture channel where the character image is found.
chnl = None¶

The texture channel where the character image is found.

height = None¶

The height of the character image in the texture.

id = None¶

The character id.

page = None¶

The texture page where the character image is found.

width = None¶

The width of the character image in the texture.

x = None¶

The left position of the character image in the texture.

xadvance = None¶

How much the current position should be advanced after drawing the character.

xoffset = None¶

How much the current position should be offset when copying the image from the texture to the screen.

y = None¶

The top position of the character image in the texture.

yoffset = None¶

How much the current position should be offset when copying the image from the texture to the screen.

class fntlib.main.Common(args: Optional[dict] = None)[source]¶

Bases: fntlib.utils.DefaultClass

This class contains information common to all characters.

Parameters:
  • line_height (int) – The distance in pixels between each line of text.
  • base (int) – The number of pixels from the absolute top of the line to the base of the characters.
  • scale_w (int) – The width of the texture, normally used to scale the x pos of the character image.
  • scale_h (int) – The height of the texture, normally used to scale the y pos of the character image.
  • pages_num (int) – The number of texture pages included in the font.
  • packed (bool) – Whether the monochrome characters have been packed into each of the texture channels. In this case alphaChnl describes what is stored in each channel.
  • alpha_channel (ChannelInfo) – Check enum ChannelInfo
  • red_channel (ChannelInfo) – Check enum ChannelInfo
  • green_channel (ChannelInfo) – Check enum ChannelInfo
  • blue_channel (ChannelInfo) – Check enum ChannelInfo
alpha_channel = None¶

Check enum ChannelInfo

base = None¶

The number of pixels from the absolute top of the line to the base of the characters.

blue_channel = None¶

Check enum ChannelInfo

green_channel = None¶

Check enum ChannelInfo

line_height = None¶

The distance in pixels between each line of text.

packed = None¶

Whether the monochrome characters have been packed into each of the texture channels. In this case alphaChnl describes what is stored in each channel.

pages_num = None¶

The number of texture pages included in the font.

red_channel = None¶

Check enum ChannelInfo

scale_h = None¶

The height of the texture, normally used to scale the y pos of the character image.

scale_w = None¶

The width of the texture, normally used to scale the x pos of the character image.

class fntlib.main.FNT[source]¶

Bases: fntlib.utils.DefaultClass

The main class that represents the .fnt file structure.

Parameters:
  • info (Info) – This variable represents the info section in the font.
  • common (Common) – This variable represents the common section in the font.
  • pages (list[Page]) – This variable represents pages in the font.
  • chars (list[Char]) – This variable represents characters in the font.
  • kernings (list[Kerning]) – This variable represents kernings in the font.
chars = []¶

This variable represents characters in the font.

common = <Common alpha_channel=None base=None blue_channel=None green_channel=None line_height=None packed=None pages_num=None red_channel=None scale_h=None scale_w=None>¶

This variable represents the common section in the font.

class fntlib.main.Info(args: Optional[dict] = None)[source]¶

Bases: fntlib.utils.DefaultClass

This class contains information on how the font was generated.

Parameters:
  • face (str) – The name of the true type font.
  • size (int) – The size of the true type font.
  • bold (bool) – Whether the font is bold.
  • italic (bool) – Whether the font is italic.
  • charset (str) – The name of the OEM charset used (when not unicode).
  • unicode (bool) – Whether charset is unicode.
  • stretch_h (int) – The font height stretch in percentage. 100% means no stretch.
  • smooth (bool) – Whether the smoothing was turned on.
  • aa (int) – The supersampling level used. 1 means no supersampling was used.
  • padding (Padding) – The padding for each character.
  • spacing (Spacing) – The spacing for each character.
  • outline (int) – The outline thickness.
aa = None¶

The supersampling level used. 1 means no supersampling was used.

bold = None¶

Whether the font is bold.

charset = None¶

The name of the OEM charset used (when not unicode).

face = None¶

The name of the true type font.

italic = None¶

Whether the font is italic.

outline = None¶

The outline thickness.

padding = <Padding down=0 left=0 right=0 up=0>¶

The padding for each character.

size = None¶

The size of the true type font.

smooth = None¶

Whether the smoothing was turned on.

spacing = <Spacing horizontal=0 vertical=0>¶

The spacing for each character.

stretch_h = None¶

The font height stretch in percentage. 100% means no stretch.

to_string() → str[source]¶
unicode = None¶

Whether charset is unicode.

class fntlib.main.Kerning(args: Optional[dict])[source]¶

Bases: fntlib.utils.DefaultClass

The kerning information is used to adjust the distance between certain characters, e.g. some characters should be placed closer to each other than others.

Parameters:
  • first_id (int) – The first character id.
  • second_id (int) – The second character id.
  • amount (int) – How much the x position should be adjusted when drawing the second character immediately following the first.
amount = None¶

How much the x position should be adjusted when drawing the second character immediately following the first.

first_id = None¶

The first character id.

second_id = None¶

The second character id.

to_string() → str[source]¶

fntlib.main.dump(value: fntlib.main.FNT, fp: IO[bytes]) → None[source]¶

Write an FNT object into a file.

Parameters:
  • value (FNT) – An FNT object to write.
  • fp (IO[bytes]) – An opened bytes-like file.
Raises:

AttributeError – if fp is not writable.
fntlib.main.dumps(value: fntlib.main.FNT) → bytes[source]¶

Write an FNT object to a string in fnt format.

Parameters:value (FNT) – An object to write.
Returns:a bytes .fnt representation of the python object
Return type:bytes
fntlib.main.load(fp: IO[bytes]) → fntlib.main.FNT[source]¶

Load a fnt file into an object.

Parameters:fp (IO[bytes]) – An opened bytes-like file.
Returns:An object that represents the font.
Return type:FNT
Raises:AttributeError – if fp is not readable.
fntlib.main.loads(value: bytes) → fntlib.main.FNT[source]¶

Load a fnt file from bytes string into an object.

Parameters:value (bytes) – A bytes string containing a fnt file.
Returns:An object that represents the font.
Return type:FNT
